questions.question: If two inputs are active on a priority encoder, which will be coded on the output?

explanations.d: The behavior of a priority encoder when two inputs are active can vary depending on the specific implementation and design, so the output may depend on how the encoder is configured.

questions.question: What will be the logic of the wires after passing through a junction having SA0 fault?

answers.a: None of them will be at logic 0
answers.b: One of them will be at logic 0
answers.c: All of them will be at logic 0

explanations.c: A Stuck-at-0 (SA0) fault forces the signal at the junction to remain at logic 0, affecting all the wires connected to that faulted junction.

questions.question: For 4-input priority encoder how many input combinations are possible?

explanations.d: A 4-input priority encoder has 16 possible input combinations (2^4), as each input can be either 0 or 1, leading to all possible combinations of inputs.

questions.question: A priority encoder converts the given decimal input into ______________ representation.

explanations.b: A priority encoder converts the given decimal input into binary representation by encoding the highest-priority active input as a binary output.

explanations.d: A priority encoder is a combinational logic circuit that encodes input signals based on priority without the need for memory elements, making it both a combinational and logic circuit.
